Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
Course Not Found
Course Not Found
Or a higher math

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introductory study of the fundamental concepts of chemistry, primarily oriented toward Health Science majors. The "NC" grading policy applies to this course.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in MAT 1033 or math placement higher than MAT 1033.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to elementary principles of modern chemistry with an emphasis on atomic structure, stoichiometry, and quantitative reasoning. This course prepares students to take CHM 2045C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Preference will be given to students whose major requires this course. An introductory study of physical and chemical properties of elements and compounds. IMPORTANT: Attendance of the first laboratory session dealing with safety procedures is mandatory; students who do not attend must immediately call the Chemistry Department, and may be dropped from the class.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: High school Algebra.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Concepts will be examined to provide insight into the significant role that chemistry plays in our culture. Intended as a general education course.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A minimum score of 550 (SAT) or 24 (ACT) in the mathematics section. MAC 1105C recommended. Not open to students with credit in CHM 2045C. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course or CHM 2045C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles of modern chemistry, units and measures, basic physical theory of chemical reactivity, stoichiometry, reactions in aqueous solutions, thermochemistry. The "NC" grading policy applies to this course.

CHM2205 - Introduction to Organic and Bi.name: CHM2205 - Introduction to Organic and Biochemistry

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 1032 or equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to organic chemistry, stressing the chemistry of functional groups and a survey of the biochemistry of proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, and nucleic acids.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0) grade or better in CHM 2045C or CHM 2041. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of CHM 2045C or the CHM 2040 & CHM 2041 sequence. Intermolecular forces, solutions and colligative properties. equilibria, thermodynamics, chemical kinetics, electrochemistry, nuclear chemistry.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in CHM 2045C and permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as CHM 2046 and CHM 2046L with honors-level content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2210. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of CHM 2210.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in CHM 2046. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theory and applications of organic chemistry: structure, bonding, kinetics, thermodynamics, reaction mechanisms, synthesis, and stereochemistry. Structure elucidation via spectrometric techniques.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: CHM 2046. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Illustration of chemical principles and introduction to the techniques of inorganic and physical chemistry. IMPORTANT: Attendance of the first laboratory session dealing with safety procedures is mandatory; students who do not attend must immediately call the Chemistry Department, and may be dropped from the class.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046 and C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046L.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Classical and instrumental analysis. Choice of preferred analytical methods and techniques is emphasized through applications involving both inorganic and organic systems.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: A "C" (2.0 or better in CHM 2046 and consent of Honors

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text:
Theory and applications of organic chemistry: structure, bonding, kinetics, thermodynamics, reaction mechanisms, synthesis, and
stereochemistry. Structure elucidation via spectrometric techniques with honors content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 1025 or a passing score in the Chemistry Placement Exam. And C (2.0) or better in MAC 1105 or math placement beyond MAC 1105. Not open to students with credit in both CHM 2040C and CHM 2041C. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course. With consent of honors

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as CHM 2045C with honors-level content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in both CHM 2046L and CHM 2210. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction organic chemistry laboratory techniques; preparation, reaction, analysis of organic compounds. *Mandatory first laboratory (safety procedures); absent students call Chemistry Department; class may be dropped.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: A "C" (2.0 or better in CHM 2210 or CHM 2210H and consent of Honors

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of CHM 2210H with honor's content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2211 and CHM 2211L.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Open-end laboratory to develop synthesis techniques & structure elucidation skills. *Mandatory first laboratory session (safety procedures); absent students call Chemistry Department, class may be dropped.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046, and C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046L.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Experimental exercise of analytical quantitative methods; titrimetric, gravimetric, potentiometric and photometric methods. *Mandatory first laboratory session; absent students call Chemistry Department; class may be dropped.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 1025 or a passing score in the Chemistry Placement Exam. And C (2.0) or better in MAC 1105 or math placement beyond MAC 1105. Not open to students with credit in both CHM 2040C and CHM 2041C. Priority will be given to students whose major requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Modern chemistry principles, units & measures, physical theory of chemical reactivity, stoichiometry, reactions in aqueous solutions, thermochemistry, atomic structure, periodicity, chemical bonding, states of matter, gases.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CHM 2040 or its equivalent with a grade of C or better. Not open to students with credit in CHM 2045C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The second semester of CHM 2040. Atomic structure, periodicity, chemical bonding, states of matter, gases. The "NC" grading policy applies to this course.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CHM 2211 and CHM 3120 both with C (2.0) or better or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Determination of chemical structure through interpretation of UV, IR, NMR, and Mass Spectra.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CHM 2211, CHM 3120 (with a minimum grade of "C" or 2.0) and

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Modern methods of analysis including electrochemistry, spectroscopy, and separation techniques.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 3410

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A discussion of descriptive inorganic chemistry based on various bonding theories, thermodynamics, and kinetics.

CHM4942 - Instructional Experiences in U.name: CHM4942 - Instructional Experiences in Undergraduate Chemistry

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ENC 1102, B (3.0) or higher in CHM 2045 and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students enrolled in course will act as Learning Assistants in a chemistry classroom. The course involves coverage of chemistry concepts and training in pedagogical techniques.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 3120 and CHM 3410.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Classical as well as modern instrumental techniques coupled with computer data processing to measure physical properties and determine atomic and molecular parameters.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 3410.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of CHM 3410.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 4610.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of physical and chemical properties and synthetic techniques in Inorganic Chemistry.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 2049C - General Physics Using Calculus II   C (2. 0) or better in CHM 2046, PHY 2049C and MAC 2312.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Physical chemistry as applied to the study of biological and forensic science.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2211 or its equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Organic reaction mechanisms and retrosynthetic analysis and their application to synthetic chemistry.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Electrochemical methods and their applications.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CHM 2211 with C (2.0) or better or equivalent

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical and experimental treatment of physical organic chemistry concepts from the perspective of modern structural theory, thermodynamics, and kinetics

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2. 0) or better in CHM 3120L.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Experimental exercise of instrumental methods of analysis. Successful students will develop practical skills performing experiments based on spectroscopic and chromatographic methods of analysis. Statistical data treatment of experimental results will be also exercised.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 4930.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student builds upon the seminar prepared in CHM 4930 and presents it to the seminar class, adviser and instructor.  Attends approved seminars.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 2046, PHY 2049C   , and MAC 2312.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Rigorous treatment of atomic and molecular structure, thermodynamics, kinetics, and chemical bonding.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in CHM 3120.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student finds a faculty adviser. In consultation with adviser, prepares draft seminar on undergraduate research or literature topic. Attends approved seminars. Completes CITI ethics course.
